Name: Issue 311
Introduction: G'day Everyone! This week sees some excellent tips and tricks for both design and performance. We are also starting to see a lot more concrete information about MAUI. Sorry for the slightly late issue, but have an amazing week ahead. ❤ Kym

Articles.Title: UI and UX tips
Articles.Description: This is part 6 of a collection of UI/UX articles which have some useful little tips for making your apps just a little bit better.
Articles.Author: Marc Andrew

Articles.Title: Xamarin Code Quality & Performance
Articles.Description: Luis shares tips and tricks to enhance your application. Definitely worth a read.
Articles.Author: Luis Matos

Articles.Title: Your Android app on Windows 11
Articles.Description: Windows 11 is going to be able to have Android apps from the Amazon store. That's cool, but what do you need to do to get your app there?
Articles.Author: Saamer Mansoor

Articles.Title: Migrating to Android X
Articles.Description: Sometimes moving to Android X can be a pain.
Articles.Author: Matt Crombie

Articles.Title: The future of Android App Bundles is here
Articles.Description: Google Play will start requiring new apps to be published with the Android App Bundle starting August 2021. This will replace the APK as the standard publishing format.
Articles.Author: Dom Elliott

Articles.Title: Exploring Automation Properties
Articles.Description: Accessibility is a huge consideration for building apps. In this article Leomaris takes a look at the various Automation properties available in Xamarin.Forms to help you on your journey.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Converter with multiple Parameters in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Have you ever wondered how to pass multiple parameters to a converter, or how to create properties in a converter to change the value based on them? If you want to know how to achieve it then keep reading .
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: App Shortcuts
Articles.Description: How to add shortcuts using Xamarin.Essentials in Xamarin.Forms App?
Articles.Author: Delpin Susai Raj

Articles.Title: Image Data Was Invalid issue
Articles.Description: Ever wanted to display an image in your app from an external source on the internet, you bind the URL to an image view, or pass it directly, but once you run your app the image doesn’t appear. Damien shows a potential fix for this.
Articles.Author: Damien Doumer

Articles.Title: Creating a Floating Label Layout with Syncfusion
Articles.Description: The Syncfusion Xamarin.Forms DataForm supports a floating label layout that includes features such as assistive labels, leading and trailing icons, and a password toggle icon to show or hide a password.
Articles.Author: Jeyasri Murugan

Articles.Title: Image Resizetizer
Articles.Description: Nick looks at using the Maui image resizer build system for his Uno project. Technically not a Xamarin article, but very interesting that we could probably start taking advantage of this over on a regular Xamarin.Forms projects
Articles.Author: Nick Randolph

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms to .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: This repository is a compilation with documentation, examples and tips when converting code from Xamarin.Forms to .NET MAUI. Keep your eyes on this one if you are interested in eventually moving your apps to MAUI.
Articles.Author: Javier Suarez

Articles.Title: Sands of MAUI: Issue #14
Articles.Description: Sam continues bring us the updates on the latest latest .NET MAUI content relevant to developers.
Articles.Author: Sam Basu

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 260: Every question answered
Articles.Description: James and Frank take your questions directly on another lighting topic episode of Merge Conflict.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 59: Automating stuff
Articles.Description: Being in IT means that automation is always something that's top of mind. Be it something in your development pipeline or something at home. We cover a range of automation bits and bobs in this episode.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Cross-platform Awesome with Shiny 2.0
Articles.Description: Today, James is joined by Allan Ritchie, Microsoft MVP, who shows off the latest version of his cross-platform library Shiny. Shiny is a cross platform framework designed for Xamarin & UWP to make working with device services and background processes easy, testable, and consistent while bringing things like dependency injection & logging in a structured way to your code!
Articles.Author: The Xamarin Show

Articles.Title: Get Creative with DrawingView
Articles.Description: Bring out your inner Bob Ross with the Xamarin Community Toolkit DrawingView. This control allows you to draw on a canvas in your Xamarin.Forms app, for instance to let your users capture signatures. These drawings can then be exported to an image, or vice versa; load a collection of points into the DrawingView.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis
